week1.meaning: A fruit that is typically round and red, green, or yellow in color.
A spherical object used in games and sports.

week2.meaning: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal with a barking sound.

week3.definition: A collection of valuable items, often gold or jewels.
The largest continent on Earth, located primarily in the Eastern and Northern Hemispheres.
The end or final part of something; a decision or judgment reached after considering facts.
The time of day when it is dark outside, typically from sunset to sunrise.
A color that is between green and violet on the spectrum of visible light.
Refers to a location or place (e.g., 'over there').
A possessive form of 'they', used to show ownership (e.g., 'their house').
The full extent or range of something, or a period of time.
No longer alive; the opposite of alive.

week4.definition: The planet we live on, or the people and things in it.
The least good or most bad; the opposite of best.
Having a higher temperature than something else; not cold.
A prize or recognition given for achievement.
Two things that are the same or match.
A sweet fruit that is typically green or yellow with a round shape that narrows toward the stem.
The number that comes after one and before three.
A preposition used to indicate direction, place, or position.
A type of insect with large, colorful wings and a slender body.
The distance from the tip of one hand to the tip of the other hand when the arms are stretched out.
A large wild cat with a golden-brown coat, known as the 'king of the jungle.'
